title: Zuur & Ieno’s 10 steps
text:
This website in an exploration of “A protocol for conducting and presenting results of regression-type analyses” by Alain F. Zuur, and Elena N. Ieno.
The 10 steps are all first presented in figure 1 of the paper:



The 10 steps


The focus of the 10 steps on on linear modelling of the type GLM, GLMM etc and uses R although it generalizes to other languages. In order to access the data and code, which we will reproduce here.
Ideally we would use a package like rdryad to do so, but I have been getting nowhere with any of its functions. It is probably broken as it is soon to be superseded by the deposits package. If I forget to update this website with the latest deposits API, feel free the file an issue on the github repo that contains the source for this webpage.
In the meantime, let’s download the files one by one.

base_dryad_url <- "https://datadryad.org/stash/downloads/file_stream/"
file_list <- paste0(base_dryad_url, c(37547:37550))
files_names <- c("monkeys.txt", "owls.txt", "oystercatchers.txt", "code.txt")
files_names_list <- paste0("data/", files_names)
mapply(\(file_name, file_path) {
  if (!file.exists(file_path)) download.file(file_name, destfile =  file_path)
}, file_list, files_names_list)

$`https://datadryad.org/stash/downloads/file_stream/37547`
NULL

$`https://datadryad.org/stash/downloads/file_stream/37548`

Step 1: State appropriate questions


Step 2: Visualize the experimental design


Step 3: Conduct data exploration


Step 4: Identify the dependency structure in the data


Step 5: Present the statistical model


Step 6: Fit the model


Step 7: Validate the model


Step 8: Interpret and present the numerical output of the model


Step 9: Create a visual representation of the model


Step 10: Simulate from the model
